fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21445].
  {panel}

The documentation describes how the new RSS feed replaces the old XML feeds:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Receiving+Search+Results+as+an+RSS+Feed

But RSS feeds fails to support sorting. I'm using RSS feed to see the latest jira issues created, but they are sorted by when the jira-issues was updated. This causes existing jira-issue to light up again, when someone posts a comment or anything else.

I want the RSS feed to use the sorting chosen by the filter.
fields.summary: RSS feed based on search filter doesn't apply sorting
Sorting of Filter Results Gadget doesn't Work when Using More Than 3 "Order By" criteria
Incorrect character comparison between different collation for MySQL
Add Watcher to issue using API (XmlRpc or SoapRpc)
Allow regular administrators to import a workflow
Search for field change
JQL: add the ability to query for the groups an user is member of
Cascading Select field should have both parent and child value validated in the 'required' mode
Allow exact-text searching in JQL
Active Directory: Support for DNS SRV records to locate an AD/LDAP server (_ldap._tcp.)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21359].
  {panel}

CAPTCHA should be pluggable in JIRA

[CAPTCHA|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CAPTCHA] is supposed to stop spam and other automated nefarious usage of systems.

But there is an arms race of [CAPTCHA breaking|http://www.slightlyshadyseo.com/index.php/xmcps-how-tobasic-captcha-cracking-techniques-part-1/] and then coming up with [new and better CAPTCHA solutions|http://blog.chromosundrift.com/2009/04/google-whats-up-captcha.html].

IN addition, like many others, JIRA's current CAPTCHA can be difficult for humans to read, see JRA-16559 .

So if JIRA had a pluggable CAPTCHA capability, it would be possible for JIRA to more quickly benefit from available advances in CAPTCHA protection without a change to the core product.

_(Oswaldo implemented this in shipit day)_
fields.summary: Pluggable CAPTCHA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21358].
  {panel}

Enable password strength rules to 

# tell the user the effective strength of the password they choose
# optionally allow administrators to restrict the minimum strength of passwords chosen by users
# be pluggable

Currently you can enforce password strength by using JIRA with Crowd
fields.summary: Password strength measurement and restriction
Save selected dashboard between logon sessions
jira.issue.editable - whitespace characters should be stripped for true/false comparison
Allow for date of updates of issues to be viewable and searchable in Issue Navigator
Duedate details never get updated when creating JIRA ticket via SOAP
Track Confluence page updates like e.g. SVN commits
Allow for searching on time between creation and resolution
Subtask bulk edit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21300].
  {panel}

For the most part, Jira uses floating tip windows to provide help for the item under the cursor. for example, the activity stream icon containing a text bubble with a + brings up a tip with "Add Commment".

This is slightly helpful.

A much more powerful way to use these tips is to allow actual data from the issue or other parts of the Jira configuration to be displayed.

For example, when hovering over a project name in the projects gadget, I want to see the project description, which Jira allows to be configured for each project. It is hilarous to me how difficult it is for a user to find where the description of each project is displayed. It would be perfect if it came up when hovering over the project name anywhere in the GUI, but especially in the Projects gadget.

I understand that using tips this way may provide a challenge for screen readers and other accessibility mechanisms. If this is the case, you could make it a per-user preference to select whether tips were used simply for help or much more usefully for contextual information.

This is related to a similar suggestion I made in JRA-21299.
fields.summary: Make more use of floating tips with useful descriptions from the Jira instance
Ability to define "Columns to display" order in "Filter Results" gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21294].
  {panel}

_Some of our customers believe that JIRA should implement a similar functionality to the Confluence one - [CONF-11554|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-11554]._

{quote}
The standard 500/server error page displays large amounts of information about the server. While this is very convenient for troubleshooting, it's a problem in environments where security is a major concern and it's important to provide as little information as possible to potential attackers.
We can, and currently have to, ask customers to customise 500page.jsp themselves. However, it should be easy enough for us to include an alternative version which simply shows the following:

CONFLUENCE
System Error
A system error has occurred - our apologies!

Please contact your Confluence administrator to create a support issue on our support system at http://support.atlassian.com with the following information:

1. a description of your problem and what you were doing at the time it occurred
2. attach the application server log file (if possible). 
{quote}

*WORKAROUND:*

If you want to remove information from 500 page, follow this guide:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Remove+information+from+the+500+page
fields.summary: Alternative 500page.jsp with minimal information

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21293].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days.

While we don't have any plans to introduce generic support for renaming any system field, we are very sensitive to the feedback that much of the terminology in JIRA is unfriendly to non-technical users. We're actively exploring ways to alleviate this in the future.

It's important to understand that we rarely try to implement individual features from jira.atlassian.com, but instead take a holistic look at the problem and use feedback from the comments here and a [dozen other sources|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com] of customer input to solve the core problems.

Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions or feedback.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

This also includes renaming 'Priority' to 'Severity' as some customers prefer to use severity.
fields.summary: Rename any system field via the admin section

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21286].
  {panel}

Bizarrely this bug only seems to occur when the Anyone "group" has admin or sysadmin permissions (as set in permission schemes). It results in a call to UserUtilImpl.getGroup with a null group (which I guess, but am not sure is supposed to represent the Anyone group). This in turn may throw an exception, depending on what is backing it.

Luckily it is unusual for people to grant admin access to Anyone, so this is unlikely to affect too many customers.

The workaround is to replace the Anyone group where it is used in the permissions scheme with a group containing all users.



An example stack trace that occurs in this situation is (though I doubt this problem is limited to Studio or GreenHopper)

fields.summary: UserUtilImpl doesn't properly handle the case when "Anyone" has permission to administrate JIRA
Jelly: add ability to create filters and dashboards
Allow showing & customising "Forgot password" link when using External User Management
View Screens page is painfully long/verbose
Filter "Save" button should be grayed out when a query has been modified
Add "authcontext" to Velocity-Context when rendering dashboard.vm

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21246].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 22 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

This would be particularly useful for hosted customers, who don't have system access to their JIRA instance, so currently they have to raise a support request to get it done, so it would take a load off hosted support.  Additionally, it would allow custom icons to be persisted between upgrades, images uploaded to the icons directory in JIRA (the current recommended way to include custom images) need to be manually migrated between upgrades.
fields.summary: Allow upload of custom issue type icons to JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21242].
  {panel}

Currently, Google have a number of restrictions on their mail service, including 

# maximum number of emails sent per day per account (2000)
# rate at which emails can be sent
# attachment restrictions
# and others.

If any of these (still yet defined) limits is reached, Google will refuse the login with a 421 and the mail service then needs to be manually restarted via the GUI. It would be better if the JIRA SMTP service would back off when a 421 is returned for a determined time and then attempt again. (perhaps we could include a Google 'template' or option for connectivity?

A potential workaround includes using postfix server locally to cache outgoing messages from JIRA - it would queue, resend, and respond as required, and this would override current issues with the JIRA mail handler that have now been exposed through Google's terms of service.
fields.summary: improve the SMTP handler to better accomodate Google restrictions on mail service
Use multipart MIME for text+html email notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21231].
  {panel}

Maybe this is multiple tickets, but here it goes:

1. On the issue detail screen, you shouldn't have to click ellipses to see the whole values - this should be the screen to see it all. I saw this specifically with the components and cc fields; I'm not sure where else it collapses in that way, and an extra click is required to see the information.

2. When on a subtask's issue detail screen, the way the parent ticket name, parent key, and the subtask's issue key is displayed, they are hard to read, because of the size, spacing and punctuation. It ends up not being easy to tell what those different bits mean the way it's laid out right now.

3. This is more general, but I have found that for many of our tickets, in the new look you now have to scroll or scroll farther to see all the information before the comments/tabbed area begins.
3a. Font on page seems larger than the font on the rest of the "site".
fields.summary: Improvements for Jira 4.1 issue screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21227].
  {panel}

In the transitions for a workflow you can group conditions with AND/OR, it would be really cool to be able to expand on this by saying that the group is a NOT group which would reverse the conditions result.

I've attached a mock-up of how I think this could look like.

This should allow for single items to become NOT actions also.

I have raised this on the JIRA Forums - "[Is it possible to have a NOT workflow transition eg "NOT current assignee"?|http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=43602]".
fields.summary: Create a NOT condition group for workflows

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21220].
  {panel}

It would be nice if incoming and outgoing email log go to their own log files. It also should have logging levels so that user can set the level for email to Debug, Info ,Warn and Error accordingly.

JIRA should:
* log the outbound email only (one line per email with recipient and subject).
* Log outbound and incoming email, but no logging of the check for mail operation (every minute)
fields.summary: Separate logs for incoming and outgoing mail

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21210].
  {panel}

Entering the start date is always a pain in the time tracking 

The start date defaults to the current time which is almost always wrong.

Suggestions

* Make the start date default to when the last transition occurred
* Make the start date default to current time minus what is entered in "Time Spent"

I'd be happy with either of these two options.
fields.summary: Make "Start Date" of "Log Work" action smarter to better guess the start time.
Change the "Report a Problem" link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21201].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; unfortunately we don't have any plans to support this in JIRA for the foreseeable future.

Here at Atlassian, in situations where we need reports with more complex layouts, we either use Confluence pages or [Atlasboard|http://atlasboard.bitbucket.org/] (for wallboards).

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].
 
I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

It would be great that the dashboard layout would be more flexible or more types. In the actual version, it is only columns, but it would be great that it allowed like an upper a lower row, that would extend acrross all the dashboard. Some gadgets look better all acrros the webpage and other work better on single columns (it allows us to make comparisons). A mix of those would be great
fields.summary: Dashboard layout should be more flexible

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21195].
  {panel}

With the new issue detail view coming with JIRA 4.1 we have real trouble because every existing custom field of the types
* date picker
* datetime picker

is now displayed on the right column under "*Dates*"!

Since we are heavily using these kinds of custom fields especially for adding functional information and not for issue processing purposes: E.g. 'starting date' and 'ending date' as descriptive information of the ticket (e.g. the travel) and not as planning information when the issue should be started and finished.

*My improvement proposal would be that these custom fields should be adjustable where it should be displayed in the screen*

This and JRA-21013 are currently for us *show stoppers* to update our and our customer JIRA insances!
fields.summary: Custom fields of the types Date & DateTime picker shouldn't be displayed under the new pane "Dates" by default
Replace Lock with ReadWriteLock in JiraCachingPropertySet

Customer wants that all custom avatar be available to all projects not only available to one specific project. Whenever the user will add an avatar to a custom project, it will be available to any future project.
Related issue: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-56972.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21182].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Issues without sub-tasks do not show aggregate values for original estimate, remaining estimate and time spent, meaning that when viewed by the JIRA Issues Macro in Confluence you do not see any values in those columns even though there should be.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue and log time against it.
# Click Export->XML for the issue and look for the field 'aggregatetimespent'

h3. Expected Results

aggregatetimespent should be present and should contain the same value as was entered in step 1.

h3. Actual Results

aggregatetimespent is not present.

h3.Workaround

None.

Note: If you add the aggregate remaining estimate field it *will not* show up even if you have a subtask.
fields.summary: Σ Original Estimate, Σ Remaining Estimate, Σ Time Spent is not in XML export view and not showing in JIRA Issues Macro when there are no subtasks
As an Agile user I can update time remaining without updating time spent
Best practice static text when creating an issue
"Email sent to..." message after editing/submitting an issue.
jfreechart generates "one time images". should generate "per-session" images

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21160].
  {panel}

I've commented on http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Starting+JIRA+Standalone+automatically+on+Linux which includes the jira.smf manifest I am using to start and stop JIRA automatically on OpenSolaris.

As the note states I've hacked this together with no real knowledge of what I am doing.
It appears to work fine on my machine so far.

A copy of the comment is included here as well:

{code:language=xml|title=jira.smf}<?xml version="1.0"?>
<!DOCTYPE service_bundle SYSTEM "/usr/share/lib/xml/dtd/service_bundle.dtd.1">
<!--
  Assumes dependency on svc:/network/cswmysql5:default

  Assumes user=jira group=other
  Assumes :home is where your JIRA instance is installed.
  Assumes :home/bin has symlinks to the actual version you are running.
-->

<service_bundle type='manifest' name='JIRA'>

  <service
    name='network/jira'
    type='service'
    version='1'>

    <create_default_instance enabled='false' />
    <single_instance />

    <!--
       Wait for network interfaces to be initialized.
    -->
    <dependency name='network'
        grouping='require_all'
        restart_on='error'
        type='service'>
        <service_fmri value='svc:/milestone/network:default'/>
    </dependency>

    <!--
       Wait for all local filesystems to be mounted.
    -->
    <dependency name='filesystem-local'
        grouping='require_all'
        restart_on='none'
        type='service'>
        <service_fmri
            value='svc:/system/filesystem/local:default'/>
    </dependency>

    <!--
       Wait for mysql
    -->
    <dependency name='mysql'
        grouping='require_all'
        restart_on='none'
        type='service'>
        <service_fmri
            value='svc:/network/cswmysql5:default'/>
    </dependency>

    <!-- execute as user jira -->
    <method_context>
        <method_credential user='jira' group='other' />
    </method_context>

    <exec_method
        type='method'
        name='start'
        exec='./bin/startup.sh'
        timeout_seconds='60'>
    </exec_method>

    <exec_method
        type='method'
        name='stop'
        exec='./bin/shutdown.sh'
        timeout_seconds='15'>
    </exec_method>

    <template>
       <common_name>
          <loctext xml:lang='C'>JIRA</loctext>
       </common_name>
       <documentation>
          <doc_link name='jira'
                    uri='http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/' />
       </documentation>
    </template>

  </service>

</service_bundle>{code}
fields.summary: Supply smf manifest for installing JIRA as a service for OpenSolaris
Allow sorting of changesets in the Source tab

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21146].
  {panel}

The error message is a generic one:
Changing the attachment, index, backup or restore settings is not allowed for security reasons. You must edit jira-application.properties and explicitly set 'jira.paths.set.allowed=true'. Restart JIRA and then the path settings will be able to be changed.

It's hard to understand because you're not trying to change settings right there, you're trying to restore an XML backup. 

It should be something easier to understand, like:
Restoring from an XML backup requires a configuration change. You must edit jira-application.properties and explicitly set 'jira.paths.set.allowed=true'. Restart JIRA and then the path settings will be able to be changed. See <insert doc link> for a discussion on security.
fields.summary: Restore from backup warning about absolute paths should be a better description, like 'You must configure JIRA to allow XML restore...'
Add checking for orphaned versions to the integrity checker...

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21118].
  {panel}

Hi Rosie,
 
I am introducing my employer to JIRA for the first time so have become the JIRA administrator by default. I have a good idea of what I'd like the system to do but would like a bit more reference/procedural material to help me set it up correctly from the start.
 
The page http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/EHOSTING/JIRA+Hosted+101 is superb - I love how you've made it possible to scan down the page using expandable links and I think the "Why would I do this?" question is a fantastic device! 
 
My request is for more information (though not necessarily for hosted services customers only):
 
1. General recommendations for setup - Include an overall workflow for new customers. Perhaps a flow diagram as well?
what you need to do and in what order. i.e. create project first, adopt or redesign issues? add users first? design project roles first?  What not to do before another task.
 
2. Personally, I have to set up this situation on a hosted system so I was looking for some more complex scenario documentation than that currently available.

    *
      e.g. For example when allocating 6 users to 3 different projects but giving them different roles in each project. Some users work in all three, some in just two. Two projects need to allow cross-project linking.
    *
      My PM wants to be able to export some issue data to export into another database - what do I need to do to facilitate this?

 
3. What are schemes really designed for? What should I watch out for when setting one up? Why does the system display both the default and the customised scheme within a given project?
 
4. Give a breakdown of a small part of a workflow and explain a typical design - what's mandatory, purpose is served by a transition,   
 
5. If I delete a default issue etc, how can I retrieve it?
 
6. The whole area of the default settings and how they can be customised is a bit confused especially as a given project is displayed as using a "default..." as well as a  ".<customised> scheme". I cannot distinguish which settings are coming from each source and would like to understand how the customised bits work... superimposed over template default?  how the default plays into a project nevertheless?. 
 
   default groups needs more clarification - for example:

    *
      a detailed table about what each of the default groups can do.
    *
      for instance why don't my new users receive a username/password email?
    *
      When I click jira-developers in the default browser, I see that there are "no permisssions/notifications/issue security or saved filters associated with this group"  yet members of that group do receive notifications. How is that explained?
    *
      what are the advantages of setting up my own groups and what should I watch out for

 
Hope this makes sense.
 
Having said that, I think JIRA is remarkably well designed. It has such a great, simple and consistent interface. And it's got extensive help! - I love the fact I can communicate feedback to the author! 
But am trying to get the hang of organising the system to suit our needs and struggling a bit.
 
Thanks, Celia
fields.summary: JIRA documentation suggestions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21101].
  {panel}

A clickjacking attack on JIRA would most likely take the form of a third-party site, containing an invisible iframe on top of an unrelated page. The iframe would contain a page in JIRA. The victim would believe he was clicking on the other site but would actually be clicking in JIRA and performing actions he didn't intend.

It enables attackers to perform many actions in our apps, provided that:
    * The victim has an active session or "remember me" is set, and
    * The victim can be tricked into clicking or typing into an innocent-looking page element on a third-party site.

It requires no XSS vulnerability in JIRA in order to exploit.

Twitter's solution to this was to include a line of JavaScript at the top of every page to break out of frames. This might not work as a broad-scale solution for us (GreenHopper and gadgets both use iframes legitimately) but could be used for administration pages at least.

This threat could be partially mitigated by requiring two clicks for any major administration action. e.g. Currently you can go directly to the project deletion confirmation page and delete a project in one click. If the confirmation page was also XSRF-protected (not just the deletion action itself), it would behave the same for an end-user but would be harder for an attacker to exploit.

-----------

Example attack: This button on some random website gives no indication of malice:

!Clickjack1.png!

But clicking on it actually deletes a project in JIRA:

!Clickjack2.png!

The example HTML for this attack is attached; just insert the ID of the project you want to delete into the iframe URL, and use with caution!
fields.summary: JIRA is vulnerable to clickjacking attacks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21097].
  {panel}

Hello,

I'm trying to find a way to make the comments in Jira visible when assigning issues. When processing comments and assigning issues to another user in Jira, the comment history is not visible so one can't see what was written by others and make comment on it. The user should copy-paste the last comment or open the issue in another IE/FIREFOX/OPERA window.
Could anyone suggest how to cope with such inconvenience in Jira?

Regards,
Dylan

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 23 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap, but there's always the possibility an engineer will pick this up for a ShipIt project. Additionally, if you are using JIRA Server, we recommend the [JIRA Syntax Highlighter Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/jira.plugin.syntaxhighlighter.macro.syntaxplugin]. We are working with the developer of that plugin to support macros in Atlassian Connect, which will allow him to bring it to JIRA Cloud.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21047].
  {panel}

Have Any restrictions on the use of specific symbols defining the radio button type field Values, such as <> "", () -?

I have a problem finding by the radio button type field values, which is used double quotes - ""
Error that no such values

Steps to replicate:

1. create radio button field:
TEST_FIELD
2. add values to this radio button field:

value 1
"value 2"
"value 3"
3. Create issue with custom field values 
(one issue with value TEST_FIELD=value 1
one issue with value TEST_FIELD="value 2")

4. Simple search for issues by the field values TEST_FIELD="value 2"

received an error message that is incorrect search query

Currently the only way to extract this information is by using the advanced query in JIRA 4+:

TEST_FIELD = "\"value 2\""

Is there a way to escape the quotes in simple search?
fields.summary: Simple search doesn't handle quotes
JIRA RSS wraps email with <a> tag
Brute force protection on JIRA 4.1 leaks valid account names

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21034].
  {panel}

The current CAPTCHA system in JIRA is both very hard to decipher for end users, and not accessible.

It would be good if there was, as a minimum, an option to generate a new image on the fly without having to reload the page. That would improve usability but not solve the accessibility issues though.

It would be great if one could, for example through a plugin, swap the default CAPTCHA provider with another one. This could solve both readability and accessibility issues. The Recaptcha project at http://recaptcha.net/ — which was unfortunately dismissed without consideration in CONF-9026 — is an excellent candidate.

Note that this improvement request is valid for other Atlassian products (e.g. CROWD, CONFLUENCE...)
fields.summary: Allow for different CAPTCHA providers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21013].
  {panel}

With the new issue detail view coming with JIRA 4.1 we have real trouble because every existing custom field of the types
* user picker
* multi user picker
* group picker
* multi group picker

is now displayed on the right column under "*People*" regardless the screen tab definition!

Since we are heavily using these kinds of custom fields for different purposes (especially for dynamic right management) we hide these fields in different screen tabs in order to not disturb the user with unnecessary pieces of information.

*My improvement proposal would be that these custom fields should be displayed in the screen tabs as defined in the screen schemes.*

And to be honest, I'm very unhappy with this new behaviour. In my point of view every custom field independent of its type has to be displayed furthermore together with the other custom field values! Or this should be adjustable!
fields.summary: custom fields of the types (multi) user picker and (multi) group picker shouldn't be displayed under the new pane "people" by default

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20999].
  {panel}

New feature request.

In light of the recent security hack at Apache, it might be prudent for JIRA to provide some more secure options for user authentication.

One candidate is two-factor authentication using the [RFC 4226 (OATH/HOTP)|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HOTP] standard. This requires the user to have a token that will generate the one-time passwords. However, several software tokens now run on cell phones, so this is less of a burden these days. This also requires an ability to configure JIRA with the token's secret hex key, which amounts to adding a new field in the edit user page.

Instead of using only their password to login, the user would enter their password followed by the one-time password generated by the token. The JIRA authentication code would compute the same one-time password to verify. The algorithm is simple and open source versions exist.

Examples of software out there using the OATH algorithm (these happen to be written by me):
* [OATH Token|http://oathtoken.googlecode.com/] for iPhone
* [mod_authn_otp|http://mod-authn-otp.googlecode.com/] Apache authentication module.
fields.summary: Allow user accounts to require two-factor authentication using RFC 4226
Subversion repository integration per component
Jelly  tag "AddActorsToProjectRole"
Administration screen is hard to find what you're looking for

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20939].
  {panel}

In order to comply with Sarbanes-Oxley audit requirements my Operations team requires that we trace changes at the jira project level, not merely at the issue level.

While jira logs change management on each issue (i.e., issue is closed, assigned, etc), my operations team has not identified a way to log and track changes at the project level (i.e., permission schemes, notification schemes, account creation, etc.).

I understand that this feature does not exist in jira, thus I'm requesting it in order to provide a full audit trail of all action within Jira.

William
fields.summary: trace log for change management of changes to projects, not issues
Add information about debugging plugins

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20916].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a shared filter having similar JQL:
{code}
project in (PROJECT1, PROJECT2) ORDER BY created DESC
{code}

2. Login as a user having only browse permission for "PROJECT2".
3. View the filter in issue navigator.
4. It shows user the number of issues allowed to see. Add a "filter results" gadget on the dashboard.
5. Select the filter.

h3. Result:
The user gets error message "The selected filter filter-<ID> has an error: A value with ID '<ID>' does not exist for the field 'project'..

h3. Expected:
Here also user should be able to view issues from project having browse permission.

h3. Notes

Attempting to access the XML view of a filter with this configuration will result in a HTTP 400 with an error similar to "HTTP Status 400 - A value with ID '10000' does not exist for the field 'project'." as per the attached image.
fields.summary: Shared filter queries don't work with "Filter Result" gadget if login user doesn't have browse permission on one of the projects.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20835].
  {panel}

After you have clicked on create new query, the functionality of "View" link doesn't make much sense. Currently it shows you an empty results screen and clears the query you were working on.

The "View" link should either:
- Not be present for new queries until they've been run
- Perform the same function as the "Search" button.
- Only be present if there was a previously run query. In which case selecting View shows the results of the previous query.
fields.summary: Behaviour of the view link in the issue navigator is odd for new queries

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20829].
  {panel}

User Story:
As a JIRA administrator, I want to grant my users the right to add arbitrary watchers to the list, but only to remove themselves, so that the users cannot unwillingly delete watchers from the list.

Acceptance Criteria:
* The current functionality must be preserved.
* An additional setting (e.g. via Permission Scheme) can grant the right to add users to the watcher list
* As a user with that additional setting, I can only remove myself from the list
* I cannot remove others from the list, even when I added them myself
fields.summary: Add permission to add, but not to remove watches
remove obsolete page 'User access logging'
URL custom field should replace white space automatically with ' %20'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20814].
  {panel}

The template file:
/atlassian-jira/secure/views/navigator/advancedsearch.jsp 

does not contain checks to ensure that a user is logged in or not like the simple issue navigator. When a user's session expires while viewing the advanced issue navigator they receive a misleading error message "Field 'x' does not exist" instead of one instructing them to login first. 

Quick workaround attached.
fields.summary: Advanced Issue Navigator does not display proper warning when user is not logged in
Ability to sort issues by release date

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20801].
  {panel}

Users should be able to specify aliases for Column names.

For example, in SQL:
    SELECT ReallyLongColumnName RLCN
      FROM ...

However, JQL does not offer the ability to alias column names.  Some aliasing is being done automatically (e.g. 'Priority' -> 'Pr'), but the user has no control over this.
fields.summary: Support Column Aliases in Filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20799].
  {panel}

When comments are created by email and notifications result in another comment (usually involving a second system similarly configured) an unbounded mail loop is created.

Today SAC was bought down by two JIRAs cross connected via their mailboxes.

Someone created an account for enterprise-hosted-support@atlassian.com on their JIRA, this caused SAC to create an issue on the EHSP support queue, and reply back to the reporter with an email saying it had done so. This caused the remote JIRA to create an issue on it's side and send a notification that it had done so back to SAC. Because this email contained the EHSP key, SAC filed the email as a comment, and replied telling it had done so. This caused the remote to create a new issue (as the issue key didn't match on its side), and reply to SAC ...

!http://img.skitch.com/20100331-jq568ibubyw825hsxxk1ya2mdb.jpg!

_hilarity did not ensue_

Also note the Ubisoft + JAC loop that happened here: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-5865
fields.summary: JIRA should limit the number of comments created via email to avoid mailing loops

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20798].
  {panel}

This issue was raised from: [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-55065]:

*Steps to replicate the problem:*
Steps:

    * Click Create Issue
    * Scroll down to description field
    * Click "?" for "wiki markup help"
    * In the resulting pop-up click the "Advanced Formatting" link
    * At the bottom of the page in the
{noformat}
      "{code:title=Bar.java|borderStyle=solid}" 
{noformat}
      section, in the "Comment" column the code is not pre-formatted.
fields.summary: /WikiRendererHelpAction "advanced" description incorrect

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20754].
  {panel}

The jira-application.properties file is a potential source of problems. 
* Some of the properties are difficult to configure correctly (for instance jira.date.time.picker.java.format/jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format). 
* It is also difficult to determine which of those properties you have changed in your installation, so you can apply the changes when you upgrade. 
* We also see customers that forget to update these properties during an upgrade, which can be quite problematic (a typical example is forgetting to update the jira.projectkey.pattern property, which results into users not being able to see issues that do not much the current pattern)

I think most of those properties should be stored in the database, with Jira providing a user interface to modify them. That means that we could do proper validation of the entries, and the values would persist during upgrades.
fields.summary: Move jira-application.properties to database and user interface

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20748].
  {panel}

I would like to know if there any third party tool available to integrate Remedy with JIRA. We want to use JIRA as one source of issue management tool within our development group. So I would like JIRA to integrate with the following tools:

(1) Quality Center (HP)
(2) BMC Remedy
(3) CA Clarity

I know there are tools to integrate with Quality Center. I am not sure about the other two.

Are there tools to do that. Basically if one group creates an issue in Quality Center, it should automatically be routed to the developer in JIRA. All the tools share the NT authentication.

I would also like to know what are the best ways to integrate with Share point servers.

Any help in this regard will be greatly appreciated.
fields.summary: third party tools integration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20672].
  {panel}

I need a very simple extension of RemoteIssue
(http://docs.atlassian.com/rpc-jira-plugin/latest/com/atlassian/jira/rpc/soa
p/beans/RemoteIssue.html ).

Currently I cannot retrieve the fields TIMEORIGINALESTIMATE, TIMEESTIMATE
and TIMESPENT. As far as I’ve seen they are not available through the API
yet.

Could you please add them? I need them very urgently and I guess it makes no
sense to create a new plugin just for retrieving these elementary fields.
Probably it’s just adding the getters to the class and extending the columns
of the select.

In case you cannot add them, could you please provide me a hint if you know
somebody who can build a plugin for me or where I could download e.g. the
current plugin source to extend it?
 
Thanks a lot! (I need to retrieve these 3 fields very urgently.)

 

Mit freundlichen Grüßen / Best Regards

Michael Kubert, Dipl.-Inform.
fields.summary: Very simple extension to jira.rpc.soap needed (RemoteIssue)
